ProductDiscount.DiscountRule.item.attrib: 1. Add the attribute name and select the attribute type. After filling out the attribute name and selecting the attribute type, you will be given a list of all available operators.
Dates must be entered in the ISO format: YYYY-MM-DD
Times must be entered in the ISO format: hh:mm:ss.sss
Entering the date and time together needs to be in the ISO format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sssZ
Currently the attribute name and type can be found only in the Admin Center (AC). More information can be found here on how to find the attribute name and type.

If you select the operators: ‘has a value’ or ‘does not have a value’ and save your Product discount predicate, the type value will reset. This is normal, a Type is not needed for these specific operators.
3. Fill in the value for the rule accordingly.
For text, enum and lenum types:
Text values can be directly added with comma separated values
Enter enum and lenum values by adding the enum / lenum keys. Use commas to separate a list of enum / lenum values when multiple values are needed.
Set of Text, enum or lenum

ProductDiscount.Form.Conditions.rulesInf: 1. Select which products to apply a Product discount to by selecting either:
Hover on the + symbol and select ‘Add rule’
Select a rule type from the dropdown list
This includes rules by Product type, Product id, Categories, Prices, Channels, Customer groups, etc.
Depending on the rule type, the possible operators will be displayed in the next dropdown
If needed, fill in a value for the rule
Then you can add a new rule or add a condition to add a new subgroup of rules
2b. To add another condition (subgroup of rules)
Hover on the + symbol and select ‘Add condition’
Select a condition from the dropdown list
Then you can add a new rule or another condition to add a new subgroup of rules
2. If you have selected ‘Apply to selected products’ you must first choose a condition:
If any of the following apply
If all of the following apply
If the following does not apply
After selecting a condition, you can add a rule or add another subgroup of rules by adding another condition.

Products.TokenizerDialog.help.tokenizerP: This tokenizer does not split up the keyword at all. We recommend this option when the whole keyword should be used. Where the keyword is made up of several words, like "Swiss Army Knife", the whole phrase "Swiss Army Knife" is indexed as a keyword for the product, but not "swiss", "army" or "knife" as separate keywords. When one of your shop visitors searches for "swiss", the search functionality may suggest "Swiss Army Knife" as an option and the product will appear in the search results. If they search for "army" or "knife", though, "Swiss Army Knife" will not be autosuggested and the product will not appear in the search results.

This tokenizer splits up the keyword into the individual words within the keyword. We recommend this option when it makes sense to break the keyword down by its words. Taking the example above, if the whitespace tokenizer is used for "Swiss Army Knife", then if a shop visitor searches for "swiss army knife", "swiss", "army" or "knife", then the phrase "Swiss Army Knife" may be autosuggested and the product will appear in the search results.
Products.TokenizerDialog.help.tokenizerS: A tokenizer is the rule used to split up a search keyword to improve auto suggestions and search results for that keyword.

ProjectSettings.Channels.Roles.InfoDialo: A channel role describes the purpose and the type of this channel. Each channel can have one or more of following roles. If not specified, then channel will get InventorySupply role by default.
Inventory Supply tells that this channel can be used to track inventory entries. (e.g. channels with this role can be treated as warehouses)
Order Export tells that this channel can be used to track order export activities.
Order Import tells that this channel can be used to track order import activities.

Primary is a special kind of role. It can be combined with some other roles (e.g. with Inventory Supply) to represent the fact that this particular channel is the primary/master channel among the channels of the same type.
Product Distribution tells that this channel can be used to expose products to a specific distribution channel. It can be used by the cart to select a product price.
